segment.source: Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM
segment.target: Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM

segment.source: Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM
segment.target: Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM

segment.source: Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM
segment.target: Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM

segment.source: You can use the Windows® edition-servicing commands to change one edition of Windows to a higher edition of Windows.
segment.target: You can use the Windows® edition-servicing commands to change one edition of Windows to a higher edition of Windows.

segment.source: The edition packages for each potential target edition are staged in the Windows image.
segment.target: The edition packages for each potential target edition are staged in the Windows image.

segment.source: This is referred to as an edition-family image.
segment.target: This is referred to as an edition-family image.

segment.source: You can use the command-line options to list potential target editions.
segment.target: You can use the command-line options to list potential target editions.

segment.source: Because the target editions are staged, you can service a single image, and the updates will be applied appropriately to each edition in the image.
segment.target: Because the target editions are staged, you can service a single image, and the updates will be applied appropriately to each edition in the image.

segment.source: You need a product key to change the Windows edition online.
segment.target: You need a product key to change the Windows edition online.

segment.source: Offline changes do not require a product key.
segment.target: Offline changes do not require a product key.

segment.source: If you change the image to a higher edition using offline servicing, you can add the product key by using one of the following methods:
segment.target: If you change the image to a higher edition using offline servicing, you can add the product key by using one of the following methods:

segment.source: Enter the product key during the out-of-box experience (OOBE).
segment.target: Enter the product key during the out-of-box experience (OOBE).

segment.source: Use an unattended answer file to enter the product key during the specialize configuration pass.
segment.target: Use an unattended answer file to enter the product key during the specialize configuration pass.

segment.source: Use Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) and the Windows edition-servicing command-line option /Set-ProductKey after you set the edition offline.
segment.target: Use Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) and the Windows edition-servicing command-line option /Set-ProductKey after you set the edition offline.

segment.source: For more information about product keys, see Work with Product Keys and Activation.
segment.target: For more information about product keys, see Work with Product Keys and Activation.

segment.source: Find and Change Current Edition of Windows
segment.target: Find and Change Current Edition of Windows

segment.source: You can find the edition of Windows your image is currently set to by mounting the image and running DISM commands on the mounted image.
segment.target: You can find the edition of Windows your image is currently set to by mounting the image and running DISM commands on the mounted image.

segment.source: To find the current edition
segment.target: To find the current edition

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to modify.
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to modify.

segment.source: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.

segment.source: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.
segment.target: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.

segment.source: Type the following command to find the edition of Windows your image is currently set to.
segment.target: Type the following command to find the edition of Windows your image is currently set to.

segment.source: Note which edition of Windows your image is currently set to.
segment.target: Note which edition of Windows your image is currently set to.

segment.source: If the image has already been changed to a higher edition you should not change it again.
segment.target: If the image has already been changed to a higher edition you should not change it again.

segment.source: We recommend that you use the lowest edition as a starting point.
segment.target: We recommend that you use the lowest edition as a starting point.

segment.source: Unmount the image or continue with the next procedure.
segment.target: Unmount the image or continue with the next procedure.

segment.source: To unmount your image, type the following command.
segment.target: To unmount your image, type the following command.

segment.source: To change to a higher edition of Windows
segment.target: To change to a higher edition of Windows

segment.source: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image (if it is not already mounted).
segment.target: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image (if it is not already mounted).

segment.source: Type the following command to find the editions of Windows that you can change your image to.
segment.target: Type the following command to find the editions of Windows that you can change your image to.

segment.source: Note the edition-ID for the edition you want to change to.
segment.target: Note the edition-ID for the edition you want to change to.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot set a Windows image to a lower edition.
segment.target: You cannot set a Windows image to a lower edition.

segment.source: The lowest edition will not appear when you run the /Get-TargetEditions option.
segment.target: The lowest edition will not appear when you run the /Get-TargetEditions option.

segment.source: You should not use this procedure on an image that has already been changed to a higher edition.
segment.target: You should not use this procedure on an image that has already been changed to a higher edition.

segment.source: Type the following command specifying the edition-ID to change the Windows image to a higher edition.
segment.target: Type the following command specifying the edition-ID to change the Windows image to a higher edition.

segment.source: Type the following command to unmount the image and commit your changes.
segment.target: Type the following command to unmount the image and commit your changes.
